title: How to Seduce Someone Using Only Your Eyes

steps.title: Watch them from the corner of your eye to see if they’re looking back.
steps.content: Watch them from the corner of your eye to see if they’re looking back. If you haven’t had an opportunity to catch their eye head-on, simply watch them from the corner of your eyes for a few minutes to see if they glance in your direction. If they do, raise your brows slightly and smile to show interest. [1] X Research source Spend 5 or 10 minutes checking out someone you find attractive from the side of your eye to see if they’re looking at you, too. Be cool, and don't make it too obvious. It can help to give someone a sideways glance while laughing at something a friend said. Laughter is infectious and can be attractive to someone you're trying to seduce.

steps.title: Initiate eye contact with a few brief glances.
steps.content: Initiate eye contact with a few brief glances. If you're shy, start things off with a couple of brief glances. A double take definitely conveys interest. Licensed relationship therapist Alysha Jeney says, “I think just like intentional locking of eyes and holding it for a few seconds at a time and maybe looking back, that sends a signal that you're interested.” [2] X Expert Source Alysha Jeney, MA, LMFT Licensed Relationship Therapist Expert Interview. 11 August 2021. By taking the initiative, you also show confidence, which many people find attractive. People tend to be interested in those who are interested in them. If you're making an effort to meet someone's gaze from across the room, it tends to intrigue them. Look for cues the other person is interested in you. Use this as an opportunity to make initial eye contact . Cues can be subtle, like someone giving a quick glance in your direction. Women may sometimes run their fingers through their hair to convey attraction.

steps.title: Hold their gaze for 3-4 seconds and smile to catch their interest.
steps.content: Hold their gaze for 3-4 seconds and smile to catch their interest. Dating and relationship coach Mark Rosenfeld says, “The biggest thing with eye contact is you've got to hold it a lot more than you think you do. Got to hold it for three to four seconds. And once you can do that, add a smile as well.” [3] X Expert Source Mark Rosenfeld Dating & Relationship Coach Expert Interview. 11 June 2021. A genuine smile shows someone you're friendly and would not mind being approached. Dating coach John Keegan says, “Smiling makes you more likable, and people will warm up to you. But if it's a fake smile… it can seem the opposite. It is suspicious.” [4] X Expert Source John Keegan Dating Coach Expert Interview. 25 May 2021. Relax the muscles around your eyes and slightly lower your lids to really get a seductive look.

steps.title: Drop their gaze and go back to what you were doing.
steps.content: Drop their gaze and go back to what you were doing. After giving "the look" glance away or look down and continue talking to your friends. [5] X Research source Keep smiling, laughing, and engaging in conversation. However, every once in a while look back at the person you’re trying to seduce. Occasional brief glances are an invitation for the person to approach you. Let your eyes meet for long enough to let them know you’re looking intentionally and didn’t just happen to be scanning the room. These little glances can help that first spark of attraction grow and build a little heat.

steps.title: Continue to make eye contact if they start walking your way.
steps.content: Continue to make eye contact if they start walking your way. Rosenfeld says that eye contact is usually the first invitation for someone to make a move. [6] X Expert Source Mark Rosenfeld Dating & Relationship Coach Expert Interview. 11 June 2021. So, when you make good eye contact with someone, be ready for them to start walking toward you. You don’t have to stare at them the entire time it takes for them to get to you, but a direct glance or two confirms that you’re interested and gives them a little encouragement.

steps.title: Drop the eye contact if they don’t seem interested.
steps.content: Drop the eye contact if they don’t seem interested. While eye contact is key to attraction, being too enthusiastic can be off-putting and even creepy. [7] X Research source Once you've initiated a conversation with someone, glance away while they're talking now and again. Don’t be rude by glancing away to look at your phone or someone else, though. Just briefly glance to the left or right to avoid overwhelming the other person with eye contact. Strive to look at someone's face about three-quarters of the time you're talking to that person. Keep your glances between one and seven seconds. This shows a genuine interest, which can be attractive, but does not overwhelm a potential partner with eye contact.

steps.title: Look at them straight on instead of from the side of your eye.
steps.content: Look at them straight on instead of from the side of your eye. Sideways glances are fine when you’re trying to see if they’re interested. But once you’ve caught their attention, it’s time to look at them directly. Maintain level, steady eye contact when talking to someone. Making eye contact during a conversation is also a good way to show that you’re interested and paying attention to what they’re saying. [8] X Research source Keep your seductive eye contact relaxed and natural during a conversation. Gradually extend the length of time you hold their gaze to communicate a feeling of intimacy. [9] X Research source A minute or so of mutual gazing can heighten the attraction between you to a near-intimate level.

steps.title: Use the triangle gaze to show your interest.
steps.content: Use the triangle gaze to show your interest. The triangle gaze or triangle method is an old-school flirting technique that people still use…because it works! It involved looking from the person’s eyes to their mouth and back again in a triangle shape. Start by focusing on one eye. Hold it for a few seconds, and then move to their other eye. After a few seconds, drop your gaze to their lips for a second and then go back to the first eye. [10] X Research source It helps you show interest and build a connection, both essential to seduction. Try to keep it natural, though. If you’re focusing too much on moving from eye to eye to mouth, you might stop listening and seem distracted.

steps.title: Serve them a wink or an eyebrow flash.
steps.content: Serve them a wink or an eyebrow flash. Jeney says expressions with your eyebrows and winking are considered flirting. [11] X Expert Source Alysha Jeney, MA, LMFT Licensed Relationship Therapist Expert Interview. 11 August 2021. Adding them to good eye contact can help dial up the sexual tension. Winking is a common way to say hello or show sexual interest. [12] X Research source An eyebrow flash is very similar. It’s a quick lifting and lowering of your eyebrows and often happens without you even knowing it when you see a friend. [13] X Research source However, eyebrow flashes are also a sign of flirting.

steps.title: Give them an up-and-down glance to show attraction.
steps.content: Give them an up-and-down glance to show attraction. Take things a step further by checking them out. Sweep your eyes over them from head to toe and back again, then smile again to let him know that you like what you see. Don’t linger too long on any part but their eyes, though. Staring at someone’s body while they’re talking to you is rude and may make them feel uncomfortable. When you're interested in someone, show it by eyeing their head and shoulders while they talk. This helps you convey attraction and avoid seeming creepy . You can also tell if a person is interested in you based on how they look at you. If someone glances at your hips and thighs, there's a good chance they're interested.

steps.title: Project interest and confidence with open body language.
steps.content: Project interest and confidence with open body language. “Body language is really important in dating…[it’s] what keeps people out of the friend zone,” says dating coach and matchmaker Erika Kaplan. Matching a confident gaze with confident, approachable body language helps bolster attraction. Keep your body relaxed and comfortable. Try to avoid tensing muscles. Give them body language cues that signal attraction . Rosenfeld says to put your shoulders back and face them with your chest or toes and arms uncrossed to make yourself more approachable. [14] X Expert Source Mark Rosenfeld Dating & Relationship Coach Expert Interview. 11 June 2021.

steps.title: Pay attention to their actions and body language.
steps.content: Pay attention to their actions and body language. Rosenfeld says, “Look at their actions and how responsive they are to the general idea of conversing and spending time with you. If they’re more responsive…have good energy…are excited to see you…then they’re into it.” [15] X Expert Source Mark Rosenfeld Dating & Relationship Coach Expert Interview. 11 June 2021. If someone is leaning closer and reciprocating your touch, they’re probably interested, adds Keegan. [16] X Expert Source John Keegan Dating Coach Expert Interview. 25 May 2021. Aside from their body language, they may show interest in learning more about you, says Jeney. [17] X Expert Source Alysha Jeney, MA, LMFT Licensed Relationship Therapist Expert Interview. 11 August 2021. Crack a joke and see how they respond. Keegan says if they are laughing a lot at your jokes, or it feels like they're getting comfortable around you,” they’re probably interested. [18] X Expert Source John Keegan Dating Coach Expert Interview. 25 May 2021.

steps.title: Seductive eyes have hooded eyes and dilated pupils.
steps.content: Seductive eyes have hooded eyes and dilated pupils. A seductive gaze often involves locking your eyes with someone using a soft gaze with hooded or slightly lowered upper eyelids. It often involves relaxing your facial muscles, especially the ones around your eyes. They’re meant to intrigue another person, so they’ll return the intense gaze. [19] X Research source Add an inviting smile to turn up the heat. Celebrities who are often said to have seductive eyes are Marilyn Monroe, Angelina Jolie, George Clooney, and Paul Newman.
